info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 9:55PM MST until July 31 at 11:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 955 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chloride, Golden Valley, Windy Point Campground, Packsaddle Campground and New Kingman-Butler. This includes the following roads... State Route 68 in Mohave County between mile markers 17 and 27. Oatman Highway between mile markers 37 and 44. Stockton Hill Road between mile markers 8 and 30. Highway 93 in Mohave County between mile markers 53 and 66. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sacramento Wash, Secret Pass Wash, Cane Spring Wash, Tennessee Wash, Meadow Creek, Thirteenmile Wash, Cerbat Wash, Griffith Wash, Truxton Wash, Detrital Wash and Hualapai Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
